result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Duarte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2022

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Duarte

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Anthony Duarte appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Michael Anthony Duarte. 
22TR242 and 22TR243 tracking with 22CM33:
Atty Gumz states that the matter is resolved today and did file the plea forms. Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 
Atty Juech states plea agreement. 
Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will vacate the judgment and reopen the traffic citations; then will dismiss based on the State's motion

Atty Gumz makes arguments and asks for a payment plan.
Defendant makes a statement.

BY THE COURT:  Pay $100 + costs = $673.50
Submit DNA sample within 60 days and pay surcharge 
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2022

BY THE COURT:  Court will vacate the judgment and reopen the traffic citations; then will dismiss based on the State's motion
Status hearing on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Anthony Duarte appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Michael Anthony Duarte. 
Atty Gumz has discovery and an offer; he needs time to speak with his client.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Anthony Duarte
Current: 3836 East Washington Ave, Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 05-05-2022)
Prior: E7179 St Road 154, Reedsburg, WI 53959

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

Atty  states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.   Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court finds probable cause for the charge.
Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
set status

3:18 PM Defendant Michael Anthony Duarte appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant does qualify and he will most likely be appointed to represent him.  
Atty Gumz states that he received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Defendant did receive the complaint.Court confirms address and phone. 

Atty Juech does not object to a signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz does not object.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:47 AM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Anthony Duarte not in court.
22TR242 & 22TR243 tracking with 22CM33:
  Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear and asks that the traffic citations be found in default.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
22TR242 & 22TR243:  Court finds the defendant in default on both matters and finds the defendant guilty; orders the forfietures and points.
  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office
